text: Jairo Lombardo (born 4 June 1997 in Panama) is a Panamanian footballer who is last known to have played for San Juan Jabloteh of the TT Pro League in 2017. Hailing from Vacamonte, he is the nephew of former Panamanian footballer .Jairo Lombardo: ‘Sí se puede jugar y estudiar' Elsiglo.comSan Juan Jabloteh Profile ==Career== ===Barbados=== Despite football being stigmatized as a sport of criminals in Panama, Lombardo pursued the sport in his teenage years, becoming one of three Panamanians making the 2013 Digital Premier Clinic in Barbados.Escogen a jóvenes panameños para ir a clínica Digicel en Barbados Telemetro There, the attacker impressed, bagging a hat-trick one game,Panameños impresionan en Barbados Laestrella.com.pa opting to stay in Barbados and enter the University of the West Indies there, becoming a part of their football team in 2016 and scoring over five goals in 8 games, including one in a 4-1 thrashing of Brittons Hill.Lombardo and Harte Strike Again UWI Cave Hill ===Trinidad and Tobago=== Bagged a brace in a 4-1 comeback over CS Moulien to steer San Juan Jabloteh to the final round of the 2017 Caribbean Club Championship.Lombardo double virtually qualifies 10-man Jabloteh for Caribbean final round TT Pro League == References == == External links == * at Soccerway * at ZeroZero Category:Panamanian expatriate footballers Category:Association football forwards Category:Association football midfielders Category:1997 births Category:Panamanian footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in Trinidad and Tobago Category:Living people Category:Expatriate footballers in Barbados Category:TT Pro League players Category:San Juan Jabloteh F.C. players
title: Jairo Lombardo
